mutations_by_lineage(mutation, location, pango_lin)¶

outbreak_data.mutations_by_lineage(mutation, location=None, pango_lin=None, freq=None, server='api.outbreak.info')¶

Returns the prevalence of a mutation across all lineages in a specified location.

Parameters:

  • mutations (str or list[str]) – (Optional). A string or list; List of mutations separated by AND.

  • location (str) – (Optional). A string. If not specified, return most recent date globally.

  • pango_lin (str) – (Optional). If not specfied, returns all Pango lineages containing that mutation.

  • freq (float) – (Optional) Minimimum frequency threshold for the prevalence of a mutation in a lineage.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame

Previous topic

sequence_counts(location, cumulative, sub_admin)
